intro: Triumfetta semitriloba var. brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian false mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the Malvaceae family.
